title: Tories pledge to cut bills as energy price battle takes shape
text:
Tories pledge to cut bills as energy price battle takes shape
The Conservatives are promising to roll back green energy rules to cut energy costs,  amid an emerging election battleground over the cost of household bills. The party has announced it would scrap carbon pricing and "rip-off wind subsidies", claiming they add 20% to electricity prices. It is the latest move from the party under leader Kemi Badenoch to turn the page on the net zero agenda that the party previously advocated in office.

counterarguments: Labour is promising that its plan to decarbonise British electricity will cut domestic bills by £300 a year, which is more than the Tories' promise of £165.
evidence: The party has announced it would scrap carbon pricing and 'rip-off wind subsidies', claiming they add 20% to electricity prices.
It comes after she opened the party's annual conference with a pledge to scrap the UK's landmark climate laws previously championed by predecessor Theresa May.

Now the Tories have revealed further details of their plans to ditch green energy rules, as they join an increasingly crowded field of promises between the political parties over how to keep family bills down.

title: Renewable Energy Growth Rate Up 45% Worldwide In 2020; IEA Sees 'New Normal'
text:
Renewable Energy Growth Rate Up 45% Worldwide In 2020; IEA Sees 'New Normal'
By  

      Bill Chappell
    
 
                Workers next to solar panels in an integrated power station in Yancheng, China, in October. An unprecedented amount of renewable power came online in the fourth quarter of 2020, according to a new report from the International Energy Agency. China alone added more than 92 gigawatts of capacity, more than triple the amount it added in the fourth quarter of 2019.

thesis: The growth rate of renewable energy worldwide jumped 45% in 2020.

evidence: According to a new report from the International Energy Agency.
